DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to compare the blood loss during sinus surgery looking at two different types of anesthesia: either intravenous anesthesia with propofol or inhalational anesthesia with sevoflurane.
DOC.brief_title: Intraoperative Bleeding During Endoscopic Sinus Surgery
DOC.criteria: male or female patients who are 18 years of age or older, ASA grade 1 (normal otherwise healthy patient), ASA grade 2 (patient with mild systemic disease), patients who have chronic sinusitis with or without nasal polyps. pregnancy, abnormal coagulation panel preoperative use of NSAIDS or ASA medications within 7 days, endstage renal disease, allergy to any of the used medications, maximal body mass index over 35
